Package it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller

Class DivinityMediator

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller.DivinityMediator
Direct Known Subclasses:
DivinityMediatorDecorator
public class DivinityMediator
extends java.lang.Object
Class that handles all god powers that influence other players' turns. It is initialized during the setup phased and decorated if divinities with such god powers have been selected.

If there are no divinities that influence other players' turns in any given game, this class serves no purpose, as it's methods will always return true.

Author:
Paolo Galli
See Also:
DivinityMediatorDecorator

  • Method Details

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove​(Worker workerToBeMoved, Square workerSquare, Square destination)
      Method called before any divinity performs a move action to check if the move is allowed by all divinities.
      Parameters:
      workerToBeMoved - Worker the caller is attempting to move
      workerSquare - Square containing the worker attempting to move
      destination - Square the worker is attempting to move to
      Returns:
      true if the move is allowed, false otherwise

    • checkBuild

      public boolean checkBuild​(Worker worker, Square workerSquare, Square target)
      Method called before any divinity performs a build action to check if the action is allowed by all divinities.
      Parameters:
      worker - Worker the caller is attempting to build with
      workerSquare - Square containing the worker attempting to build
      target - Square the worker is attempting to build on
      Returns:
      true if the build action is allowed, false otherwise

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin​(Worker worker, Square workerSquare, Square origin)
      Method called before any divinity declares itself the winner to check if the action is allowed by all divinities. Because all divinities with additional win conditions either move (Pan) or are not affected by other divinities (Chronus), this method will only (and always) be called after a move action; hence the need for the "origin" parameter, as the move has already happened and this class can't and shouldn't be able to obtain the previous state of the game (in this case, the worker's position before calling this method).
      Parameters:
      worker - Worker that has potentially won the game
      workerSquare - Square containing the worker that has potentially won the game
      origin - Square that contained the worker before moving and calling this method
      Returns:
      true if the worker has won, false otherwise
